data.title: Trooper Albert Slade
data.text:
Name of Ancestor: Albert James Slade

Ancestor's date of birth: 29/01/1882

Ancestor's date of death: 29/12/1926

Cause of Death: . Albert died of Rheumatic Heart Disease having contracted Scarlett Fever when in South Africa.

Service Number: 1762

Colony or State of enlistment: NSW, Place of Enlistment: Coolamon

Unit: 3 Bn Australian Commonwealth Horse

Rank attained in Boer War: TPR, Date Effective: 08/02/1902

Highest Rank attained (if served after war): No evidence of post Boer War service

Murray Page: 182

Contingent: Second Australian

Ship: Manhattan, Date of Sailing: 01/04/1902

Memorial details: Sandgate Cemetery Section 2, Section 124, lot13

Awards/Decorations: Queen's South Africa Medal

Personal Characteristics: Height: 1.72 m. A labourer from Coolamon NSW prior to enlistment. Married 17/06/1915 Died 29/12/1926. Three Children. Margaret deceased 21/09/2003. Frances James deceased 1991. Veronica Unknown Status.

Reasons to go and fight: Unknown

Details of service in war: Unit arrived too late to see service in South Africa.
